sudo dhclient: Renew the lease and obtain a new IP
nmap -sV <target>: Probe open ports to determine service/version info
nmap -O <target>: Determine the OS of the target
nmap -A <target>: Enable OS detection, version detection, script scanning, and traceroute
nmap -sU -sV -sC --script=all <target>: UDP scan with version detection and default scripts
nmap --script-args-file=<file_name> <tar: Provide NSE script args from a file
nmap --script-trace <target>: Show all data sent and received
nmap -iL <input_file>: Scan targets from a list in a file
nmap --excludefile <exclude_file>: Exclude targets using a list in a file
nmap -Pn <target>: Treat all hosts as online -- skip host discovery
nmap --reason <target>: Display the reason a port is in a particular state
nmap --open <target>: Only show open (or possibly open) ports
nmap --packet-trace <target>: Show all packets sent and received
nmap --data-length <size> <target>: Append random data to sent packets
nmap --source-port <port> <target>: Send packets from a specified source port
nmap --max-parallelism <number> <target>: Maximum number of probes in parallel
nmap --max-retries <number> <target>: Set the max number of port scan probe retransmissions
nmap --host-timeout <time> <target>: Give up on target after this long
nmap --script-timeout <time> <target>: The script itself may set a lower timeout
nmap --min-rate <number> <target>: Send packets no slower than <number> per second
nmap --max-rate <number> <target>: Send packets no faster than <number> per second
nmap --badsum <target>: Send packets with a bogus TCP/UDP/SCTP checksum
nmap --data <hex_string> <target>: Append a custom payload to sent packets
